one_reviews_text: A simple short film where you watch a shaman commune with nature and alternate to locomotive viewpoints from the animals' perspectives, [spoiler] then the shaman is murdered by you... unexpected and not exactly family friendly. Okay graphics but a questionable message / moral.
Mystifying
A beautiful short film!
try it out.
So cool how you can have a (presumably) made up language and still understand the character's emotions.  It was beautiful, heartfelt and really cool.  Awesome to have stuff like this in VR

This will have you looking all around in awe! Such a well done visually stunning story with great animations that really bring emotions!
A must try experience!
I really enjoyed this visually, but I didn't get the story.
Very cool
Title says it all, if you can't handle involuntary locomotion then don't get this

This was really short (which I knew going in), but all the automated motion made me feel sick pretty quickly. I am not usually super-sensitive to VR nausea, but I couldn't really enjoy what was going on because of the feeling and dread for each upcoming motion-filled scene.

Also, I didn't understand what happened or why.

Not for me, I guess, but I appreciate that it had a really neat environment, a fun, friendly secondary character doing things in the background, and that it was free.
Aweso,e flyimg experience. I Love virtual reality.
Enjoyable immersive short film with a visually interesting alien environment.
cool
Impressive, great concept, well done. It's also colorful and amazing. this is great entertainment.
This was worth the download. The most impressive implementation of VR film I have seen so far. Very impressed. I hope this studio produces more work.

Finally, after years of owning the Oculus this is the first experience which has made me think, "Yes, this is the future of film entertainment"! 

I loved it and the immersion was pefectly done, largely helped with little things companies just don't usually do for some reason, like camera shaking when you're running etc. (other companies take note! Your vision is not still when running!!).

I have waited so long for something to make me actually feel like I was flying and the experience prior where you're being chased on the ground was just as amazing. More please!

I was surprised by this.  Amazing experience, wish it lasted longer.  Very well done, not to mention some fine artistry by a talented team.  It's like going on a ride.  The flying scene was incredible.  I've had my VR headset for 2 years, thought I've seen it all, and this little film brought back that wow feeling for me.

review_title: I really expected more based on reviews
one_reviews_text: Different strokes, I guess.  I was not particularly impressed.  Barely rose to mildly interesting for me.
This was hands down, one of the best experiences in VR I have had to date...this is why I bought my Rift, to experience crazy sh*t like that   :)

God, people depress me sometimes!  For everyone saying this is "too dark", let me share a secret with you; we need darkness to appreciate the light. We need to know pain to know what pleasure is. We need to have our hearts broken to truly appreciate love, and we need to remember that death awaits us all, in order to quit taking the beauty of life for granted, as we're so apt to do.  This is a beautiful story, in part BECAUSE of the darkness in it.  Those of you who have had to walk some very dark, lonely paths will know exactly what I mean. For the rest-I don't know; try reading Man's Search for Meaning or something. Learn to see the beauty in ALL of life's experiences.

I realized half way through, my mouth was agape! lol! The level of WOW was off the charts! The people complaining about the ending not being for kids (disagree, it isnt THAT dark) well not every experience is built for every person...thats like saying PG 13 movies are bad for not being for 5 yr olds. 

 To those saying "I can't interact! I don't understand this game demo!! D:" It clearly states in the description, it isn't a game...it literally says "non-game" If only I could see a full length movie like this! A follow up game would be amazing as well lol, but, im happy with either!

 This is a MASTERPIECE! Although short, im excited to experience this many more times! This is also going into the "show off VR" to new people queue ! 

Thanks for the great experience!!

I Love The little transitions from the animals
(My favorite is the flying bat)
I Love The Graphics
I love the animation
I love the depth
------------------
What I don't like is the STORY!!
Normally when you create something rather it being a cartoon, animation ect 
it always follows a story that way the audience can feel and create this bond (no pun intended) with the movie.
Another thing that kinda cought me off guard is the ending 
I won't spoil anything but i think the ending is alittle dark don't you think?
I want my family and my little sister and my cousins to watch this but i can't really do that when the ending is this dark...

I really hope you guys make more because the animation is amazing!!!

review_title: I want to explore this world
one_reviews_text:
This is a beautifully made short story, and absolutely worth your time.

It's a solid 4 stars really, but can have a 5th as the visuals showed me a world that I want to explore, and to top it off they didn't try and charge for such short experience (unlike some others).

I hope they develop this world into something else, whether a full length story or a even a game - I'd pay for either.

Reading other reviews might lead you to believe the ending is dark, but there is a lesson and I enjoyed it. This was very thoughtful experience. If you enjoyed Avatar or Princess Mononoke, you will really enjoy this.

For those who may want to experience this film let it be know that it is NOT interactive with the exception of your 360 view.  Also, it is very short.  Neither of these things are bad though and this is probably my favorite of all the animated shorts that have been made to date.  The world it takes place in is breathtaking and I'll be using this as a VR introduction tool for new people.  I do hope these devs do more stuff in the future if not a game based on this world.  My jaw dropped.  It was just that good.

Have to say, I thought this was a very nice short movie.  I LOVE these experiences, and truly have a heartfelt appreciation for the devs that do this type of work.  Great job and looking forward to more from you guys/gals!

This is a trippy beautiful psychedelic metaphisical Shamanistic short VR movie that certain people will love and get and others may not. This is not for hard core gamers who like shooting, violence, and lots of action. This is a trip into a psychedelic, metaphysical fantasy world that makes a statement against violence. I would love to see more of these kinds of experiences and is my main interest in VR — experiencing beauty and fantasy worlds that make you feel like you’re in a lucid dream...

It's probably the best VR movie I've see so far, even though it's quite short. The movie reminds me a lot of Avatar, and the movie played flawlessly using super sampling 2.0 on my rig (GTX 1080). The graphics are truly beautiful. It's a 7 minutes movie, but it did move me more than several other full length movies.

On the plus side, there are beautiful, well-made, colorful environments. (And it's not a geometrically skewed video.) On the minus side, there is a non-harmonious combination of solemn ritual and fast action (and murder). It's a really short "movie" that uses magic so readily that it "takes the magic out of it".

review_title: Shakeycam in VR is not pleasant
one_reviews_text: Stunning world, but this experience breaks pretty much every rule in the VR book of best practices. At times control of the view is completely taken away from the user's head movement. During one of the chase scenes the viewpoint is shaken up and down as the creature gallops. I have my VR legs for Onward etc but that bit made me really dizzy. There's no freaking way you should share this with anyone unless you're happy with the possibility of them feeling terrible afterwards.

review_title: Can't be watching the same thing.....
one_reviews_text:
Oh...er.
Well, judjing by the reviews already posted I really did expect more. I mean, we all know free stuff has a limit, no problem with that at all.

The thing is, it was over very quickly (fair do's, IT COSTS NOTHING!) and I presume there will be much more to come?
On the basis of this **non-Interactive** demo I'd give it 1* only. It works of course, but it only shows a few cartoon characters that I can't interact with. I can't move, I can only look around, at poor GFX...GFX are NOT everything of course, just sometimes you gotta stop looking like "Giants: Citizen of Kabuto" circa.....1982??? You get my point, I ...hope..
So, not for me then! ....Obviously ;-) Free is OK, go for it if you want!. 

Just ensure you are NOT paying for your Bandwidth by the the Gigashizzle!!!
Nice visuals horrible traumatic story.

review_title: Three little vignettes with a bookend
one_reviews_text:
I guess if simplistic storybooks are your thing then maybe it's a great ride? But I was left kind of cold. 

It was interesting to see the POV-shots of animals and creatures (although you need serious VR-legs to stomach some of it). But in earnest. its biggest flaw is that it doesn't stray away from the well trodden norms of what oculus insists on promoting as "experiences". It's not an "experience" it's a tech demo. 

And after seeing dozens of them we want more, at least I want more. I want more than the predictable storybook scenarios where we wait for characters to finish their animation so the next bit of immersion can start. I want characters that actually feel like individuals and not puppets flung around. I want my stories to challange what I thought was possible with visual storytelling. 

"experiences" like these are just preaching to the choir. A choir ever dwindling as they get bored with being fed with the same narratives over and over.
Just really good. I hope these guys make more VR films, and I plan to support their efforts if they do. :)

That´s it. I want a Game. It is a litte bit like the movie "Avatar"

6 Stars for the Ideas and Colors.
Fatastic animation, Oculus should give them money to make a full film.
Just WOW ! I love the experience and the story !
This was a great demo and it looks like this studio has potential for great stuff. Can't wait for their next project soon, maybe a game?
Wow, fantastic!
If only full blown movies could be experienced like this!

This is a great 10-15 minute short story with no voice acting. The story is servicable, not great but not bad. The artwork and visual is where it shines. The artwork has lots of bright and vivid colors. It's very imaginitive. Worth the free download and 15 minutes of your time.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zvL6FCo9jCU (Please note: Links do not work yet from Oculus so please search YouTube for 'Paradise Decay VR The Bond' 

This experience is phenomenal, if the devs are reading, please, please go the route of Astro Bot and give us a full game experience in this magical universe! We beg you!

...why you guys have to go dark at the end of these things?  I had the same problem with The Great C: fine storytelling, exciting method of delivery, but tough to share it with anyone when the ending is so depressing.  I swear, Breaking Bad broke storytelling for an entire generation...

Great well made, but Pegi 7? Yes it is unrealistic, but in VR it become even more realistic. So not sure rater see whole 8min or so.
O.k. Mild violence probably covers poke someone with spear throught your own eyes. I wouldnt let it to see it my children. They can accept in several ways. Enjoy it or have trauma, or take it as normal... all three possibilities seems to me be really bad. Such mild violence in RL cant imagine. But lot of schoolars are mild violent then.
Edit: Actually rerated it proved that VR experience need different rating. Ppl are mad if they showed it to their small kids and didnt see any problem with it.

Awesome VR animated movie short. Beautiful environments. Nice animations. NIce little story. You will be inside the eyes of different animals & perspectives, including flight so hold on to your seat (not suited for those who get VR nausea).
Beautiful experience. If there's one minor negative is that the forced camera movement in a couple scenes can be disorienting for some  people.
fun movie that really used the VR well. Not for the easily motion sick.

review_title: Pretty good, but not for children
one_reviews_text: beautiful world, kinda looks like Avatar, very interesting story, but it´s not for children
Intense for those who suffer motion sickness, but this is just so cool!
This is very well made, and done right for VR.
Easily one of the best animated shorts i have seen in VR. The world and character design is nothing but stunning. Well done!
JUST HORRIBLE!
